data.question: What is the molecular formula of astellifadiene?
What method was used to confirm the absolute structure of astellifadiene?
What organism was genome mined to produce astellifadiene?
What was the purpose of using [1-13C]sodium acetate in the study?
data.answer: To investigate the cyclization mechanism leading to astellifadiene

data.question: How many degrees of unsaturation does astellifadiene have?
What was the role of Aspergillus oryzae in the study?
data.answer: It was used for the heterologous expression of the terpene synthase gene to produce astellifadiene

data.question: What does the presence of four olefinic carbon atoms in the 13C NMR spectrum of astellifadiene suggest?
data.answer: It suggests a tetracyclic backbone for astellifadiene

data.question: Why was the crystalline sponge method chosen for determining the absolute structure of astellifadiene?
data.answer: Because astellifadiene is an oil and not suitable for common diffraction studies, and the crystalline sponge method can directly determine the absolute configuration without crystallization

data.question: What does the incorporation of one atom of deuterium into astellifadiene in 2H2O indicate?
data.answer: It proves the existence of the second round of cyclization initiated by the protonation

data.question: What was the result of incorporating either [1-13C, 2H3]sodium acetate or [2-13C, 2H3]sodium acetate into astellifadiene?
data.answer: The resultant labeling patterns were consistent with the proposed cyclization mechanism

data.question: What does the labeling pattern of astellifadiene not following the isoprene rule indicate?
data.answer: It indicates the occurrence of C-C bond migration(s) during the biogenesis of astellifadiene

data.question: What was the purpose of performing in vitro assays with recombinant EvAS expressed in Escherichia coli?
data.answer: To further investigate the cyclization mechanism to synthesize astellifadiene

data.question: Is astellifadiene a sesterterpene hydrocarbon?
Was the crystalline sponge method used for the first time to determine the absolute structure of a chiral hydrocarbon?
Does the crystalline sponge method require crystallization of the compound for structure determination?
Is the absolute configuration of astellifadiene determined by NMR spectroscopy alone?
Was [1-13C]sodium acetate used to investigate the planar structure of astellifadiene?
Does the molecular formula C25H40 indicate that astellifadiene is a pentacyclic compound?
Is the crystalline sponge method destructive to the sample?
Was the crystalline sponge method applied to determine the relative stereochemistry of astellifadiene?
